main event: A cigar-shaped object emitting a green light was observed near San Antonio, Texas, on 15 July 1952. It flew extremely fast and appeared to be silent except for a faint whistle or exhaust noise. The object disappeared rapidly after being in sight for approximately 10 to 15 minutes.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be approximately 2000 feet in the air and traveled at a speed of 500 to 600 mph.
The sighting occurred at approximately 10:00 p.m., and the duration was estimated to be approximately 1 minute.
No logical explanation for the sighting was apparent, and no physical evidence or interruption/investigation action was reported.
The observer was a highly educated individual with a degree in physics from the University of Texas and had an intense personal interest in unidentified flying objects.
Weather conditions at the time of the sighting were clear, with a visibility of 15 miles and winds aloft at 33,000 feet from 159 degrees at 10 mph.
sighted object: cigar-shaped object emitting a green light
photographs: no visible photographs in the report
